list_definition.definition: a mythical beast, a usually large, winged, fire-breathing reptile

list_ex_of_english: The pavilion has a projected hip-and-gable roof supported by two columns decorated with carved entwining dragons.
Furthermore, she appeared to self-correct primarily on the basis of semantic information (dragons do not bark).
They long for tanks and the "dragons"and the"whippets" to come along the rural roads, because then they can put in for compensation—and get it, on a very handsome scale.
He questioned his adviser about how the name could mean nine dragons.
I am concerned about the proliferation of ombudsmen—like the dragon's teeth or the story of the sorcerer's apprentice, they seem to be spawning everywhere.
A crusade against dragons can be both inspiring and exciting.
I fear that we are sowing dragon's teeth and that we shall regret it bitterly as time goes on.
